segment.source: Categorizing Your Compatibility Data (Windows 10)
segment.target: Categorizing Your Compatibility Data (Windows 10)

segment.source: Categorizing Your Compatibility Data
segment.target: Categorizing Your Compatibility Data

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: To customize and filter your compatibility reports, you can create categories and subcategories to assign to your applications, computers, devices, and websites.
segment.target: To customize and filter your compatibility reports, you can create categories and subcategories to assign to your applications, computers, devices, and websites.

segment.source: By default, Microsoft provides the following categories:
segment.target: By default, Microsoft provides the following categories:

segment.source: Software Vendor.
segment.target: Software Vendor.

segment.source: In this category, you can, for example, create a subcategory for each vendor.
segment.target: In this category, you can, for example, create a subcategory for each vendor.

segment.source: You can then use this category to generate reports by software vendor, which can be helpful when having discussions with a specific vendor or evaluating the vendor’s performance relative to your compatibility requirements.
segment.target: You can then use this category to generate reports by software vendor, which can be helpful when having discussions with a specific vendor or evaluating the vendor’s performance relative to your compatibility requirements.

segment.source: Test Complexity.
segment.target: Test Complexity.

segment.source: You can use this category to help with planning and assigning test resources.
segment.target: You can use this category to help with planning and assigning test resources.

segment.source: You can, for example, create subcategories like Critical and Nice-to-Have.
segment.target: You can, for example, create subcategories like Critical and Nice-to-Have.

segment.source: Categories are extensible, multiple-selection string values, so you can use them for almost anything.
segment.target: Categories are extensible, multiple-selection string values, so you can use them for almost anything.

segment.source: For example, you can create a category for signoff from multiple owners so that software can be authorized only when all categories have been selected, indicating that each group has signed off.
segment.target: For example, you can create a category for signoff from multiple owners so that software can be authorized only when all categories have been selected, indicating that each group has signed off.

segment.source: As another example, you can create a category for unit of deployment.
segment.target: As another example, you can create a category for unit of deployment.

segment.source: You can use subcategories such as Division and Region.
segment.target: You can use subcategories such as Division and Region.

segment.source: You can use this category to track the software needs of a specific deployment unit.
segment.target: You can use this category to track the software needs of a specific deployment unit.

segment.source: This way, you can see when the software required by the unit has been tested, approved, and is ready for deployment to the unit.
segment.target: This way, you can see when the software required by the unit has been tested, approved, and is ready for deployment to the unit.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The following examples use the OperatingSystem - Application Report screen.
segment.target: The following examples use the OperatingSystem - Application Report screen.

segment.source: You can alternatively use the ApplicationName dialog box.
segment.target: You can alternatively use the ApplicationName dialog box.

segment.source: You can also complete these procedures in the reports for computers, devices, and websites.
segment.target: You can also complete these procedures in the reports for computers, devices, and websites.

segment.source: Creating, Renaming, or Deleting Categories and Subcategories
segment.target: Creating, Renaming, or Deleting Categories and Subcategories

segment.source: You can manage your categories and subcategories from both the report screen and report-details screen.
segment.target: You can manage your categories and subcategories from both the report screen and report-details screen.

segment.source: To create, rename, or delete a category or subcategory
segment.target: To create, rename, or delete a category or subcategory

segment.source: On the OperatingSystem - Application Report screen, click any application name.
segment.target: On the OperatingSystem - Application Report screen, click any application name.

segment.source: On the Actions menu, click Assign Categories.
segment.target: On the Actions menu, click Assign Categories.

segment.source: Click Category List.
segment.target: Click Category List.

segment.source: In the Categories or Subcategories area, do any or all of the following:
segment.target: In the Categories or Subcategories area, do any or all of the following:

segment.source: Add a category or subcategory, by clicking Add.
segment.target: Add a category or subcategory, by clicking Add.

segment.source: Type the name of your new category or subcategory, and then click outside the active text area.
segment.target: Type the name of your new category or subcategory, and then click outside the active text area.

segment.source: You must create at least one subcategory before a category will appear in the Assign Categories dialog box.
segment.target: You must create at least one subcategory before a category will appear in the Assign Categories dialog box.

segment.source: Rename a category or subcategory, by selecting the item and then clicking Rename.
segment.target: Rename a category or subcategory, by selecting the item and then clicking Rename.

segment.source: Type the new name, and then click outside the active text area.
segment.target: Type the new name, and then click outside the active text area.

segment.source: Delete a category or subcategory, by selecting the item and then clicking Remove.
segment.target: Delete a category or subcategory, by selecting the item and then clicking Remove.

segment.source: After you have finished adding, renaming, and deleting categories and subcategories, click OK to close the Category List dialog box.
segment.target: After you have finished adding, renaming, and deleting categories and subcategories, click OK to close the Category List dialog box.

segment.source: Assigning Data to a Category and Subcategory
segment.target: Assigning Data to a Category and Subcategory

segment.source: You can assign categories and subcategories from both the report screen and report-details screen.
segment.target: You can assign categories and subcategories from both the report screen and report-details screen.

segment.source: To assign and unassign categories and subcategories
segment.target: To assign and unassign categories and subcategories

segment.source: On the OperatingSystem - Application Report screen, click the application name.
segment.target: On the OperatingSystem - Application Report screen, click the application name.

segment.source: On the Actions menu, click Assign Categories.
segment.target: On the Actions menu, click Assign Categories.

segment.source: To assign a category, select the check box next to the applicable category or subcategory.
segment.target: To assign a category, select the check box next to the applicable category or subcategory.

segment.source: To unassign a category, clear the check box.
segment.target: To unassign a category, clear the check box.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: You can use the query builder to filter based on this information.
segment.target: You can use the query builder to filter based on this information.
